title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
{{{  
mflorea left at 00:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
Lord\_Devi - (01:00): I'm confused here trying to rename a page. I initially created it (by accident) as a space. So it was a WebHome... but I went to move it into a space I had created to store such documents.. It moved fine, but in it's new location it still has it's old name... When I rename it, or look in the space's document index it appears to have the name I renamed it to, but when i View the page, it has the ol  
Lord\_Devi - (01:01): old name listed at the very top of the wiki entry... And it is not visible in the source... so I'm not sure what is going on here.. Can someone enlighten me?  
sdumitriu - (01:01): That is the title of the document  
sdumitriu - (01:02): When you edit the document, don't you see a Title field on top of the content?  
hcross left at 01:03 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
Lord\_Devi - (01:03): Ah yes =) You're right I found it!  
Lord\_Devi - (01:03): Thanks sdu  
hcross joined #xwiki at 01:23  
hcross left at 01:52 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
hcross joined #xwiki at 01:56  
Lord\_Devi - (02:29): Trying to add some wiki links to a panel i made by putting the space's webhome link in the panel as such "[[TEC+Wiki.WebHome]]" but when saved the link gives the url "http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/TEC+Wiki/WebHome?parent=xwiki:Panels.Tec+Wiki" which is not what I want! If I change the [[TEC+Wiki.WebHome]] To read [[Main.WebHome]] it displays a working example url..  
Lord\_Devi - (02:29): http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ which is more like what I want for my TEC+Wiki.WebHome page.. What am I missing/doing wrong here?  
Lord\_Devi - (02:31): [[Tec+Wiki.WebHome]] expected URL http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/TEC+Wiki/  
sdumitriu - (02:38): Does the Tec+Wiki space exist?  
Lord\_Devi - (02:39): Yes I've created it  
sdumitriu - (02:40): If the generated URL contains +, then something is wrong  
sdumitriu - (02:40): + in a URL is the same as a space  
sdumitriu - (02:40): + is the encoding of a space in URLs  
sdumitriu - (02:40): So it actually links to [[Tec Wiki.WebHome]]  
sdumitriu - (02:40): Which doesn't exist  
sdumitriu - (02:42): But normally it should link to something like this: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Tec%2BWiki/WebHome  
sdumitriu - (02:42): Are you sure the URL contains + and not %2B?  
sdumitriu - (02:42): Don't look in the status bar, open that link  
Lord\_Devi - (02:42): Yeah ok  
sdumitriu - (02:43): The status bar decodes URL escapes  
Lord\_Devi - (02:43): well in my url at the top in firefox it says TEC+WIki... hehe... which I think that is showing me what it is... Kind of looks like a typo to me.. Should be Wiki not WIki...  
Lord\_Devi - (02:44): \*tries to fix and see if that is it...\*  
Lord\_Devi - (02:47): Hrm, nope that wasn't it =/  
Lord\_Devi - (02:48): Yeah I haven't seen any %20's in my urls or anything sdu  
Lord\_Devi - (02:48): Just TEC+Wiki..  
sdumitriu - (02:49): Weird, could be a bug  
sdumitriu - (02:49): THough it works for me  
sdumitriu - (02:49): Well, a quick tip would be to not use + in the space name  
Lord\_Devi - (02:49): You mean when referencing it with [[]]?  
sdumitriu - (02:50): No, I mean at all  
Lord\_Devi - (02:50): Oh! Well I was only using it because xwiki seemed to be!  
Lord\_Devi - (02:50): How should I treat spaces then?  
sdumitriu - (02:51): Hm, what is your space called? "Tec Wiki" or "Tec+Wiki"? The one that you created  
Lord\_Devi - (02:52): "TEC Wiki" (without quotes)  
Lord\_Devi - (02:52): the + only appears in the url when i go to it... which is why i was using that to refer to it  
sdumitriu - (02:52): Oh, then just use space in the link  
sdumitriu - (02:53): [[Tec Wiki.WebHome]]  
Lord\_Devi - (02:53): Oh  
Lord\_Devi - (02:54): grrrr, lol that did the trick for me  
Lord\_Devi - (02:54): something that simple. ok well awesome. Thanks again sdu =)  
sdumitriu left at 05:11 (Ping timeout: 256 seconds

hcross - (08:44): I've just observed that if an object is being used in 'inline' action mode, object.paramname or object.get('paramname') will return the HTML code for the input form related to this object...  
hcross - (08:45): I was thinking that only Document.display('paramname') has this behaviour  
hcross - (08:46): however, considering this solves for me a BUNCH of weird bugs I had on my xwiki devs  
hcross - (08:46): hope this will help  
hcross - (08:47): solution : object.get('paramname','view') return the value (or at least its string representation) works  
hcross - (08:54): ... sorry, mispelled previous line : object.display('paramname',view')

vmassol - (13:34): tmortagne: seems there's a pb with the code macro execution, probably some memory issue with the jython init: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core/5694/console  
tmortagne - (13:41): vmassol: not sure, it would produce an outofmemory exception or something  
tmortagne - (13:43): vmassol: see http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-core-2.2/23/console seemas there is a general issue of memory  
tmortagne - (13:43): i restarted core build  
tmortagne - (13:44): will restart the agent if there is still issues  
vmassol - (13:44): ok  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 13:54  
tmortagne - (13:58): vmassol: seems ok now, don't know what was the issue...  
vmassol - (13:58): ok  
vmassol - (14:11): sdumitriu: is create.vm used anymore to create blog posts or panels? I don't see from where it would be called, any idea?  
sdumitriu - (14:12): Nope  
vmassol - (14:12): so should we remove the #if parts for creating blog posts/panels or should we keep them?  
sdumitriu - (14:12): It was used in early skins, from the create menu  
vmassol - (14:12): ok  
vmassol - (14:12): then we need to keep for backward compat  
vmassol - (14:12): right?  
sdumitriu - (14:13): Yes  
vmassol - (14:13): do you know what skin?  
sdumitriu - (14:13): Nope  
vmassol - (14:13): toucan only had the create panel AFAIR  
vmassol - (14:13): and that panel no longer has the blog/panel item in its list  
vmassol - (14:13): ok?. since I've modified it I wanted to ensure it continues to work  
vmassol - (14:23): lunch time? bbiab  
bblfish - (14:25): hi, my component needs to be initialised with a certificate + private key, which needs to be available on the wiki somehwere. I think those are usually in a PEM file, which can be opened with a password  
GillesSerasset left at 14:28 (Quit: Quitting!  
bblfish - (14:29): just wondering how I should get access to the name of the PEM file from the component, and its password.  
jvdrean - (14:30): bblfish: it's a server-wide certificate right ? could this PEM file be stored as a wiki page attachment ?  
sdumitriu - (14:30): jvdrean: That's not safe  
bblfish - (14:30): I suppose it could be, but it should not really be visible  
sdumitriu - (14:30): The certificate should be unaccessible from the wiki  
sdumitriu - (14:31): bblfish: But a component is Java, can't you just access it the normal Java way?  
bblfish - (14:31): yes  
bblfish - (14:31): should I do that in the initialize() method of the component?  
bblfish - (14:31): and where would I get the properties?  
bblfish - (14:33): (in the case of foaf+ssl certificates, it turns out that the singing certificate is in fact come to think of it, not such a security issue)  
bblfish - (14:33): (we were even thinking of having certificates with public private keys)  
tmortagne - (14:35): restarting agent1 on hudson, xvnc seems down again  
bblfish - (14:48): I can even just put the certificate in the jar file, and get it that way...  
vmassol - (15:31): sdumitriu/tmortagne: I wouldn't mind a review of the commits I've just done for 2.3M1 (when you have time)  
tmortagne - (15:31): vmassol: sure  
vmassol - (15:31): it's using the new services stuff  
vmassol - (15:31): and manipulating references from vm files  
vmassol - (15:32): I've also made changes we haven't agreed on re the create space/page UI so I need feedback on this too  
vmassol - (15:33): (I talked to JV before but we haven't discussed it on the list)  
vmassol - (15:34): unfortunately it's not yet working with any char in doc names?. I need to track the calls, there must be some other place using strings somewhere in the path  
tmortagne - (15:39): asiri just fixed the office import issue, anything else needed before the release ?  
vmassol - (15:51): tmortagne: wdyt about the toucan skin issues?  
tmortagne - (15:52): did not looked very closely, is it new ?  
vmassol - (15:53): new or not, I think it means you cannot add users when using the admin and the toucan skin  
vmassol - (15:53): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSTOUCAN-141  
tmortagne - (15:54): testing  
tmortagne - (15:56): it's not very nice but it's working, you can click on save button and the user is save with the proper values  
tmortagne - (15:56): but i think i found another issue  
tmortagne - (15:56): testing on colibri  
tmortagne - (15:58): it's now impossible to create a user with a password shorter than 6 characters, doe snot seems right to me  
vmassol - (15:58): well that's a feature  
tmortagne - (15:58): making it configurable why not but it should not be like that by default  
vmassol - (15:58): introduced by caleb  
vmassol - (15:58): it's been like this for some time already  
tmortagne - (15:59): i doubt that  
tmortagne - (15:59): i usually create "test" users  
vmassol - (15:59): for at least 2 or 3 releases  
tmortagne - (15:59): never havze issue with "test" password  
vmassol - (15:59): I've bene testing this at every release  
vmassol - (15:59): the change was in 2.2M1 AFAIR  
tmortagne - (15:59): you mean 2/3 2.2 releases  
vmassol - (16:00): we even talked about it  
tmortagne - (16:00): don't remember it  
vmassol - (16:00): (on irc only)  
vmassol - (16:00): it's not configurable easily btw  
vmassol - (16:01): (you need to edit the registration page and make a change in it so that requires some coding knowledge)  
tmortagne - (16:01): IMO for the same reason we don't enabel captcha by default this should not be enabled either  
vmassol - (16:01): I don't agree  
vmassol - (16:01): it's not the same reason  
vmassol - (16:01): the captcha is only for public wikis  
vmassol - (16:01): which is the minority  
vmassol - (16:01): that's why it's off by default  
vmassol - (16:02): here it's a security feature  
vmassol - (16:02): and usually it's better to be more strict than less strict  
vmassol - (16:02): in any case  
vmassol - (16:02): if you think it's not right  
vmassol - (16:02): we should discuss it on the list  
vmassol - (16:02): and we can fix that quickly  
vmassol - (16:02): (if need be)  
tmortagne - (16:02): it should have been discuss on the list before introduceing it...  
vmassol - (16:02): it could have been indeed  
vmassol - (16:04): do you want to send a mail to discuss it now quickly?  
vmassol - (16:04): personally I'm ok with both  
tmortagne - (16:05): if i send a mail there will be no time for a release today...  
tmortagne - (16:08): starting the release we can always change that latter anyway it's not like it was something at storage or authenticator level  
vmassol - (16:10): we should put it in the release notes though if it's not already clear  
vmassol - (16:10): and explain how it can be changed  
tmortagne - (16:11): yes  
vmassol - (16:42): hmm seems our selenium test fwk is not compatible with FF 3.6  
vmassol - (16:44): hmm might be snow leopard actually  
vmassol - (16:44): checking  
vmassol - (16:46): ok found ticket: http://jira.openqa.org/browse/SRC-743
